Reviews.Title: “Great Job!”
Reviews.Author: Donna N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn on Gretna Road in Branson Missouri from September 4-7th, 2012. Everyone that worked there was very pleasent and helpful. The manager, Steve Garber, was exceptional. There were two bus loads of handicapped individuals. There were all very hard workers. We think the staff of the motel were outstanding in the way they did everything to make them comfortable. Not many motels would accept that many people with severe handicaps at one time. We commend them for a job well done. Sincerely, Lou & Carol Trombley Salem, MO 65560

Reviews.Title: “Annual shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: LittleRockcruiser
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Inn is very clean with friendly, helpful employees. The location is convenient to Tanger Outlets and easier to deal with traffic than staying on 76. If you are already familiar with Branson then this is a good choice. The rates are a little pricey if you don't have a discount of some kind, I paid $80.00 per night but I noticed that the standard internet rate was around $110.00. They offer a continental breakfast that is average with other hotels. I've stayed here previously 3 times and found it to be consistent. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: junkcar
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this Comfort Inn and the room quality, landscaping, breakfast and friendliness of the staff was impeccible again. The complete breakfast was very good with a lovely lady serving it. Our room was good sized with a couch so we could sit together and enjoy the large screen TV. I liked the separate sink outside the bathroom, great for couples. One thing I noticed again is the windows and screens are sparkly clean...unheard of in most hotels. Very comfortable, enjoyable stay again and we will return. We highly recommend this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this property on a recent vacation to Branson, MO and it is a first class facility. We purposely did not want to stay on the main drag in Branson but this hotel is only 3-4 miles away from any attraction you'd want to visit. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The ticket office was great to work and knowledgeable of any shows or attractions and their ticket prices were very reasonable. The breakfast area was very busy but well maintained and kept clean. I would highly recommend this property for anyone planning a stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith D
Reviews.Content: Everything from check-in to check out was excellent. Every time we passed a staff member they were very friendly . The location of this hotel was within 3 miles of almost all of the attractions in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN BRANSON”
Reviews.Author: DonnaGarner222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Comfort Suites, Gretna Rd., Branson, Missouri, this summer. This motel is a full-service facility, is huge; and even though it is not brand new, it has been refurbished beautifully. The rooms are large with 2 queen beds and a queen sofabed, nice furnishings, a large bathroom with an easy-to-use shower. What made this motel special for us is that we had a "Jesus in the Temple" moment where my husband thought I had packed the laptop; and I thought he had packed it. When we had gotten halfway home to Central Texas, we received a phone call from the motel telling us that they had found our laptop. Instead of the cleaning crew stealing the laptop (who would know?), they took it to the motel desk where the manager went to the trouble to call us, packed up the laptop with lots of packing material, and was kind enough to mail it FedEx. We received the laptop safe and sound within two days. We value honesty and friendly service; and it is our pleasure to be able to recommend the Comfort Suites, Gretna Rd. in Branson, Missouri, to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and accessable to everything”
Reviews.Author: Jack G
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Comfort Inn was very enjoyable. Staff was very friendly, hotel was very clean, continental breakfast is good. This hotel is off of the heavy traffic areas, but within 5 minutes of anything (excluding traffic time on 76). I can definitely recommend this hotel while you visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ron A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the cleanest and best maintained properties that we have ever stayed at. I was amazed at the quietness of our room, even though the hotel was completely full. The Myers family (who own 6 hotels in Branson) are the best in the business. We have stayed in 3 of their hotels over the years and they are all excellent. We really like the location and decor of this hotel. The staff has always been wonderful and extremely helpful.. This last week, we had car trouble and had to stay in Branson one extra day. The hotel was booked up for the night, so the desk clerk Helen told us "don't worry, we will find a room for you for tonight". Within minutes, she found a room at the Comfort Inn West for us that we could check into early (11:00 am.) and even drove us over there, since our car was in the shop. I would highly recommend this hotel (and any other Myers hotels) to anyone visiting Branson who wants a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: SandLBecker
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived even though it was past check in time. They were very busy the night before I guess. The manager was great and let us rest after a long day in another room until ours was ready. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: Was not sure where to book.. after viewing Travel Advisor we decided on Comfort Inn Branson Meadows... The hotel was great... clean, spacious... everyone very polite. We loved the breakfast every morning.. our 3 night stay was perfect... Would stay here again or recommend anyone to stay at this location....

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price!”
Reviews.Author: crismiss
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here on a trip to the midwest. We walked in,no reservations, and got a great room at a fabulous price. The room was very clean, furniture and carpet were in great shape. It looked clean, felt clean, and smelled clean. The bedding was excellent. Breakfast was good, included waffles and bacon in addition to pastries, cereals, muffins, etc. The staff members, including the gift shop employee, were thoroughly knowledgeable of the area and gave us excellent directions and info on the surrounding area. We had a great stay, will stay again, and will recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Briandlinda
Reviews.Content: Two adults and three teens and this hotel was a match made in Branson. They have good service, nice big rooms, a nice pool, game room, exercise room, and a decent breakfast. Keep in mind this place will have families with children, so if you do not have patients with with young ones being around at breakfast , in the halls ect.. then stay clear. We love the location kinda on the noth side of Branson, which keeps you away from a mess of traffic, just a little south. Place is clean and well run! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on a Scenic Hill adjacent to Sight and Sound Theatre”
Reviews.Author: Lampstand
Reviews.Content: A great rate on an extremely well-kept property in Branson! It is conveniently located next to Sight and Sound Theatre. (See Picture) Nice rooms. Friendly staff. Clean facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven Is A Short Walk From Here..”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: Please excuse this late review because it's been a couple of years since my stay but my experience at this Comfort Inn was so pleasant that I feel compelled to share it. Several years ago we had a family reunion in Branson and had the unforunate experience of staying at the Ramada (but you can read that for yourself on their review section). After leaving the Ramada after one day AAA booked us easily into this Comfort Inn and from the beginning it was heaven (Or pretty darn close). The staff was extemely nice and very sympathetic to our experience at the other hotel and went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our stay with them (they succeeded). The room was very clean and bug free (read my review about the Ramda and you will understand why I say that). The front desk was very helpful with tips on shows and things to do in Branson (great location off the strip btw) and the on site gift shop was a great convienence we were not expecting. We are returning to Branson in July of this year and if it was not for the fact our money is very tight, we would be staying here again. But believe me if we have any problems with our other hotel I would not hesitate to stay here again, no matter what the cost. Thanks to the Staff at this Comfort Inn for our great stay and I am happy to read (according to the current reviews) that this hotel has kept up it's high standards of service and cleanliness. On future trips, after the economy gets better along with the paycheck, I hope to be staying here again on future trips to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “What More Could You Ask For?????!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaleSwansea_IL
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 7-9 and had two rooms with connecting door. Our room had a king bed with a recliner. Wonderful. Other room had 2 queens. Both rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. A/C blower runs constantly with compressor only kicking on when needed--so you don't hear the blower cycling on and off all night. King room had one sink with big mirror and long table. Queen room had 2 sinks--one outside the bath area and one inside the bath, stool, and tub area. Flat screen TV's, microwaves, fridges, iron and ironing boards. You can even make your own coffee in your room. Bath even had a heat lamp which is great for cold weather. Only complaint is that the Golf Channel was not on the TV lineup. The breakfast area is fairly large with many tables and chairs. Great breakfast--hot and cold items. Scrambled eggs, sausage links, biscuits and sausage gravy, either blueberry or maple pancakes, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, 3 kinds of cold cereal, bagels, cream cheese, many types of donuts, toast and jelly, peanut butter, 3 types of juices, and very good coffee. The attendant kept the items well stocked. Didn't use the pool facility but looked great with the pool, hot tub, and sauna. Used the treadmill in the fitness room. Are 3 other items that can be used. Has a real nice gift shop and you are given a coupon for a discount for items bought there. Very friendly staff. The only complaints that I have are: 1) the hotel has four floors but only one elevator. Not good when completely booked; 2) the computer is next to the check-in desk on a table with the screen facing the lobby area. Had to stand up. Would be nice to have it on a desk with a chair to sit on. Maybe this is the hotel's way of keeping computer time to a minimum. This hotel has a great location. On the Shepherd of the Hills Expressway on the north side of town (red route). The Sight and Sound Theater can be seen only about 4-5 blocks away. Is very easy and quick to get to any area of town. Had a very good rate while here using my Choice Privileges card and discount provided. Would definitely stay here again since this hotel won the hotel franchise's top award for 2011. And, you can get coffee 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LauriH44
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here - the room was clean, comfortable and had convenient little extras. The staff was friendly. Loved the fridge and microwave. We would definitely stay at this Comfort Inn and Suites, and will seek them elsewhere on other trips.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN BRANSON”
Reviews.Author: daldrich47
Reviews.Content: One of the best kept places we've stayed. Clean throughout with friendly helpful staff. Our room was clean and modern. You'll start your day with a good hot breakfast and amble over to the gift shop where you can get a complete day by day listing of all the current shows. The ladies in the Gift Shop are very friendly and can book you for any shows you want to see and will provide you with a map to get there. It's a little ways off the strip, but Branson is easy to navigate, plus you'll find more attractions as you drive around,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Dale_Walker72455
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the huge room that was clean and quiet. The pool was the cleanest ever! The staff were great - would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CalamityJane55
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year while in baseball tournaments. Staff is friendly, rooms are clean and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay is satisfactory. Can't get much better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: chelmail
Reviews.Content: First the bad. Well it is not that bad, but as a family of 5 it is hard to find places to accommodate us. So when I find a hotel that lets me book 5 in a room without a hassle, God bless them. Thank you. However it was kind of a tight fit. Not much extra room, especially with the couch out in a sofa. And, as is typical, the sofa bed wasn't very comfortable, so I'm told. And at night there was another family above us who let their kids run wild and kept waking me up (I didn't complain so the hotel had no way of fixing it). But for a reasonable rate we were able to stay at this hotel and have a nice wonderful breakfast and the kids could swim. We were close to all of the attractions and everything else about it was comfortable. There were two sinks and mirrors (one in the bathroom with the toilet and shower) which was very helpful. The kids enjoyed the pool. And to top it off, I am a choice privilege member and my name actually was on the billboard out front welcoming me. That's never happened before. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ksmom2Kansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March 2012. Our room was the largest they have, which is two doubles and a sofabed. The room also included a small refrigerator, two sinks, and one flat-screen TV with plenty of cable channels. The room was very quiet, even though the hotel seemed quite busy. The indoor pool and hot tub looked great, although we didn't have a chance to use them. The fitness room was small but adequate. Breakfast was good, with eggs, bagels, biscuits, sausage, yogurt and three kinds of cereal. Location was excellent, close to the "red route" of Branson. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: glc817
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful, quiet location with open space around it. The interior was well maintained and had lots of character with real stuffed animals including a bear! It's not a cookie cutter interior. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The hot breakfast was generous with many choices of breakfast items. The hotel is in walking distance to the Mansion Theater. The location is away from the 'tourist' strip, but a good base for exploring other areas of Branson. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: stubbornme
Reviews.Content: This is where my res was transferred to after the tornado. Even though I was getting a room cheaper than what they reserve them for, you wouldn't know it from their service. They matched the rate from my best western res. when they discovered my mom was in a wheelchair they gave us a handicapped room that had 2 beds, so that my nephew would have his own bed and my mom would be safe. I will definitely be staying here until the best western is repaired and then I may have to alternate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdicks1743
Reviews.Content: We spent several days at the Comfort Inn and found it to be exceptional. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. We will stay here on our next return.

Reviews.Title: “Can see why it is Inn of the Year!!!”
Reviews.Author: okiejohn
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel!!! We enjoyed the decor and the friendliness of the staff. The food items were great on the continental breakfast carte. Walking paths and just overall nice place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mizzoualum
Reviews.Content: We are currently on the second evening of a three night stay at this hotel. The staff of the hotel are cordial and efficient. The room is an excellent value for the price paid. You will find the rooms very clean and up to date with flat screen televisions, refrigerators, and microwaves. This is not a luxury hotel, but is one of the nicest Comfort Inns we have ever stayed in. We will stay here again if we return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and very clean”
Reviews.Author: northernerpalmtreelo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was away from the hustle and bustle of the main strip, but handy to the shows and attractions.The room was very clean and had a large bathroom. It was very quiet. The staff was excellent and very helpful. We would stay here again when in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveleyesok
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked last minute, so we didn't have a lot of options. It was very average, nothing fancy. Had a free breakfast but it was very crowded and under staffed, they couldn't keep up with all the people that were in there, but maybe we just went at the wrong time? The air conditioning didn't work very well in our room and there was a slight musty smell. It was ok for an average hotel, but I prefer to pay extra for a little nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “ALL THE COMFORTS OF HOME, INCLUDING HOT BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: BOO70
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights recently at this hotel, and thought it was superb. Our room was clean and spacious. Beds were comfy with 5 pillows each. Big flat screen TV. Indoor pool, exercise room, and hottub. Quiet. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend to anyone who likes good food for breakfast, and the amenities I have listed. We could not have asked for more. Manager was very helpful and was seen alot working at the front desk; unusual for a place of this size. All employees were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Howbald
Reviews.Content: I hate to tell you what a great hotel this is because it will be harder for me to get a room each time I go back! These folks do it right! This was my third time to stay there and each time has been a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the friendliness and service”
Reviews.Author: Patsy H
Reviews.Content: This particular Comfort Inn has been by far the best we have ever stayed in (and it isn't the first Comfort Inn we have stayed in). Their people were extremely friendly and interested in helping in any way possible. The ladies that were handling the purchasing of tickets for the various shows were on top of it; the housekeeping people were not only friendly but good at their jobs. Their breakfast was also better than most. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to Connie Robinson for putting together all of our tickets, maps, and brochures!! We had a great week and would certainly go back!! Brenda S.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SMH_2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean. I love the decor of this place, especially since I am from the country it makes me feel like I am at home. It is well located... not to close to the busy strip... but close enough. The people here are very friendly and willing to answer any questions you may have. When I visit Branson, MO again I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Generae01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights during our recent vacation in Branson. The room was clean and we always had plenty of towels. Towels were probably my only complaint. Some of them seemed a bit thin but other than that it was all good. The rooms aren't terribly exciting and the TV is the old tube type not a flat screen but we never turned it on so it really didn't matter. The beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet. The hotel was very full but we never heard our neighbors or people out in the hall talking. We never used the pool but it's open until midnight and it's all indoors so the kiddos have plenty of time to swim if they choose. Breakfast choices were good and the staff was very friendly. The location of this hotel isn't on the strip but it's very easy to get around. We had no desire to stay near Hwy 76 and we were very happy with the location of the hotel. Whether you wanted to head to downtown or Silver Dollar City it was very easy to get to either place. We'll stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bigred1972
Reviews.Content: Great Inn, Very clean and Friendly from the time we entered until checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tntross
Reviews.Content: Our family was greeted upon entering the lobby and the hospitality continued from there. After checking in, we entered our room to a surprise, a phone call from the front desk asking if our room was satisfactory to our liking. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We staye din a Queen Suite and had 5 people. Included a great breakfast that included eggs, sausage, potatoes, yogurt, cereals, oatmeal, and breads. Outstanding accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “BEST STAFF EVER”
Reviews.Author: Coachmjb
Reviews.Content: We took a travel baseball team to Branson for a tournament and chose this hotel based on price and lcoation (off the strip). The hotel was very clean and well kept, rooms were neat and tidy, no complaints about the facility. The best part of this hotel was it's staff. Over- friendly might be the best words to describe them. The manager attended several of our tournament games! I have been coaching travel ball for over 10 years and this is the only time this has ever occurred. Not only did he attend, but he acted like our biggest fan!!! Several of our parents are planning a fall Branson trip and we won't even search for a place to stay, as we have our favorite Branson hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Now We Know”
Reviews.Author: Blessed2BMom
Reviews.Content: We come to Branson often, therefore we are trying to find a hotel that we will always use. We believe we have found it! We have tried two other hotels. They were fine, really, they were. But, this particular Comfort Inn and Suites just set the bar too high!! Clean - check, Friendly - check, Accommodating - check ~ OUTSTANDING hotel all around!! Don't hesitate to book a room and be completely thankful you did!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mtparker57
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect because this was only our second trip to Branson, but the Comfort Inn was excellent, clean, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: WWGIII
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most phenomenal hotels I’ve ever experienced. I’ve traveled extensively and stayed in numerous 5+ star hotels, but none of them compared to the sense of welcome and treasured guest atmosphere that this facility and staff gave to us. It sets a new bar for wholesome atmosphere with lots of quite repose aspects. The staff team was outstanding. Great breakfast that was well attended and spotlessly clean. Pool area and hot tub were both well attended and very clean. Close enough to all the activities, yet away from all of the hustle and bustle of the tourists. A most welcomed atmosphere at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalibuSearcy
Reviews.Content: I made reservations in March to stay at this hotel for the dates of Aprl 8 and 9. I talked to the manager to make the reservations and told him I was reserving it to celebrate my wife's birthday. I didn't expect any special treatment. But, when we checked in our room was waiting and they had given us a suite for the price of a regular room. The manager and all the staff were nicer than nice. You could not ask for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: We just stayed three nights at this hotel. The hotel is located next to the Mansion Theater, about 1/2 mile off the main strip (very good location). The hotel is well maintained, clean, and has a nice staff. The room was average, not overly large, but worked for us. The hotel has a nice indoor pool which the kids enjoyed every night. They have a free breakfast that was decent, but we were disappointed that they offered the same menu every morning. Overall, this is a nice place to stay in Branson and we would stay there again. Note about Branson: I have been going to Branson since I was a kid (30+ years). Branson hit a peak about 10 years ago and has been going downhill ever since. The hotels and restaurants on the strip should overall be avoided. I suggest staying and dining away from main road (HY 76). Many on the restaurants on the strip need to be shut down by the health department (no joke - read the reviews of the Plantation and Baldnobber’s restaurants). I still recommend Silver Dollar City but suggest you really do your homework on trip advisor before make a trip so you can avoid being disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in Branson!”
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a very nice staff. Clean modern rooms and comfortable beds. You can tell the staff cares about making you comfortable. Has a nice free breakfast. Convenient to Branson attractions without being in the middle of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and joy at the Comfort Inn in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: Joyce2720
Reviews.Content: After Christmas we decided to take our 2 little granddaughters for an after Christmas get away. After searching on line I decided on the Comfort Inn West in Branson. When got there and realized the pool was located in a different building than where we were staying - and being that it was very cold out - and the girls were really excited about swimming; I did not want to take them outside in the cold after swimming with wet hair, etc. So I went and talked to the receptionist and she immediately got on the phone and started calling other "sister hotels" to find me another place to stay. She found us a room at the Comfort Inn and Suites on Gretna in Branson. They were able to match our price without hesitation which I was very pleased about. The rooms and pool were very nice, clean, comfortable and very affordable. And believe me I am extremely picky! The breakfast was great - much more than what is usually offered in hotels for free. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling alone or with families. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rates as one of the best in the Choice Hotel's chain”
Reviews.Author: JOlaskowitz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel all around the country and this hotel rates way up on the list of the many Choice Hotels we have stayed. The staff is courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is up to date and kept in superb condition, and the deluxe breakfast is by far one of best in the chain. The location is convenient to all the attractions in Branson. Our room was spacious and well maintained. Whenever we visit Branson we are sure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, but I'd stay closer to the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: tagnrocky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was modern & clean. The staff was friendly & helpful. I was disappointed in the breakfast. We both made waffles and they had a sour taste. I think the batter was added to instead of being freshly made and had turned yeasty. There were other foods to eat instead, which were fine though. We were quite a way from the strip however and nothing much within walking distance. Next time we'll try one closer.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: RKMJ
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel in the first part of October. We were in town for a Don Williams concert. We visit Branson several times a year but this was our first stay at the hotel. I was very impressed with the whole stay. The staff was very friendly and had alot of knowledge of the area. The rooms was comforable. The hotel is in a pretty spot in a good location. This is where we will stay from now on.

Reviews.Title: “the "cottage" is a fantastic, nice, private spot with all the amenities!”
Reviews.Author: breezey_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "cottage" which is actually a private home adjacent to the parking lot at the comfort inn and suites. We had total privacy, including a deck, bar-b-que pit and picnic table, but was 30 feet from the hotel with all their amenities. My teenage son, LOVED the pool table, game room, great swimming pool/hot tub. I LOVED the great jaccuzi in our private bedroom at the house. The best night's sleep I have ever had on a hotel bed. Personnel at the hotel were absolutely THE BEST. Lovely location, very high, nice views. I sat out on our private deck in the morning drinking my coffe and looking at the beautiful scenery. Their breakfast buffet is very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: INSURANCERON
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with staff and location. Room was very nice - even has his & her sinks. Only problem I had was the pillows were half the size of a normal pillow, and the staff said nothing else was available. Room 315 is very quiet, ask for it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “We Always Stay At Comfort Inn & Suites Branson When We Come to Town"”
Reviews.Author: HollyMo
Reviews.Content: My family and I try to go to Branson for a short get away about once a year and we have stayed at Comfort Inn & Suites Branson since it opened. Once we found it, there was no need to stay anywhere else. It is comfortable, inviting, clean, roomy for our family of five, and a good value. The suite is perfect for our family with the two queen beds and the pull out sofabed. The beds are very comfortable. The location is IDEAL! We enjoy the friendly, professional staff, who truly make you feel welcome. The breakfast is great and offers lots of options for everyone. The game room is fun. The pool area is inviting and relaxing. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely keep going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Supermomto4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times, and as far as we are concerned, there is no need to try out any other hotels in Branson. The hotel is in a great location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean. The pool and hot tub are clean. They have a great exercise room. The hot breakfast is fabulous, and there are lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Truly great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sbbsaver
Reviews.Content: Great location and excellent staff that wants to make the stay go well. When we saw a tour bus and several vans with teens in Branson for a conference, we thought, "Oh, no." The hotel handled them without a hitch. The breakfast room never ran out of food, and just worked constantly to make things flow. The pool is large enough for crowds, the ice machines kept up with demand--making us realize that a full hotel doesn't mean poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: SallyJo57
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Branson. We are so glad we chose the Comfort Inn & Suites on Gretna Road because they were wonderful. Not only was the staff super friendly and helpful but the hotel was beautiful. We really appreciated how clean the rooms were also. The breakfast was wonderful. We really enjoyed the biscuits & gravy and also the waffles. The location of this motel was off the main strip but very convenient to all the shows and shopping. If we ever go to Branson again we would definitely stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites on Gretna Road.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Contenter
Reviews.Content: We have gone to Branson several times. This was our first stay at the Comfort Inn. It was very clean, service was impeccable and the location was grat. Away fromthe "strip" bussle, but near another to everything. We will stay here the next time we are in Branson

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: taressw
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Memorial Day weekend. The hotel staff was very friendly. The rooms were clean. I used the wireless internet in my room and it worked fine. We swam in the pool and hot tub and both were nice. Towels were provided. The location is great. It is not on the strip but easy access to the strip. The view from our room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Motel !”
Reviews.Author: greenwel
Reviews.Content: Great motel in Branson - VERY clean, VERY friendly personnel, GREAT location (off the strips but very close to everything and much quieter than others might be). As soon as entered motel, friendly greetings. Open Bible with prayer for rest, etc. on dresser.

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself a Favor; Stay Here While You Play in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: davewalkjr
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 Queen bed with sofa for 2 nights. My wife and adult daughter found the property very, very nice the moment we pulled in the drive. The entire place was very clean! Room was nice size for the 3 of us. Extra sink/mirror was nice too! Pool area was clean as was the breakfast room. And, the breakfast was far more than the usual cold stuff. We had waffels, eggs, biscuits and gravy, along with many choices of drinks, including "coffee that came out of the wall"!I Must add, from the moment we walked in, the staff was VERY friendly (just as you would expect in Branson) and helpful. I asked for another stand to put a suitcase on, and we had one! Gift shop is nice too. The first night we stayed here I used Choice Hotels points, the second night we had to pay for. In the past, I sometimes find that staff treat you a little different when they find out you are burning up points. They know they are losing the revenue for a room. Here,we were treated like royalty. We really do appreciate not having to deal with young folks that make you feel like they are doing you a huge favor by checking you in before the normal check in time. We will be back, we loved it here!

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SportsTraveler6
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 3 nights...one had my elderly mother and the other had my husband, four boys and me. From the time we pulled in (and saw my name on the welcome sign) to the time we checked out, it was great. Clean, friendly staff, good breakfast, and nice location. The lodge decor was great. One word on location, Greta Rd isn't bad at all -- it's not on the strip, but you also don't have to deal with the strip traffic and congestion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trippin09048
Reviews.Content: We have stayed @ this hotel every year since it opened. We go to Branson multiple times each year and always stay here. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful and have gotten to know some of them, and the breakfast is great. We have always had a great experience staying @ this Comfort Inn on Gretna Rd, Branson, MO., and will continue to stay here in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: procrastinate
Reviews.Content: This may not have been the cheapest hotel option, but I was so glad I chose it. The staff was friendly and helpful, even going out of their way to find a room at another hotel for an elderly couple that arrived late without reservations when they were sold out. Breakfast had a lot of choices, plenty of tables, and was well-stocked even right before it was supposed to end. The room was large. The whole hotel was spotless and well-decorated. This was by far the nicest Comfort Inn we have ever stayed at. We thought the location was great - a short drive to everything and quiet since it's off the strip. There was also plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “we had a great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: ttccc
Reviews.Content: the staff was so nice and breakfest was a plus since we had four grandchildren along made it so much easier then going out really enjoyed our stay there

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: CindyCharles
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that this is a no-smoking hotel. The staff was so friendly, everyone we encountered was so nice. The location is super because you're close enough to the strip, yet a mile away so that there was no noise. It's real easy to get anywhere as this is a great base. The breakfast was well attended and food replenished quickly. The quality was really good. We'll definitely stay here again, especially since the bed was so comfortabe.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel and a Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: rdwacw
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at this hotel. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The staff was very prompt in checking us in on time. The room was very comfortable and clean. The location is great because it is away from the Strip. This makes getting in and out of the hotel very easy. The hotel sits atop a hill and has a nice view. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was very nice. A nice selection of eggs, biscuits, cream gravy, assorted breads, pastries and juices were served. The staff promptly replenished all breakfast items. The only cons I could give this hotel is the slow internet, one elevator and the small bathroom. The bathroom does have an extra sink right beside the main bathroom which really helps. All of these factors are very minor. You can see why this Comfort Inn was voted Inn of the Year. Its management team does well in making everyone feel welcome and running a hotel that caters to its customers. When returning to Branson, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Hiddengem00
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, would never try another hotel in Branson. Breakfast, staff, rooms, just great!!! Thank you guys on a great trip and congrats on Inn Of The Year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GrannyHuntsville_Al
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 50th anniv and our selection of hotel was most definitely the right choice for us. We had a King suite which was very comfortable and clean. We especially liked the location, off of the busy streets but close enough to get around quickly. Enjoyed the convenience of high speed internet in the lobby. The on site ability to get show tickets was the best thing for us, no hassles,no lines. We told her what we like to see and she made some good suggestions, got us good seats, gave us good directions and quick ways to get to our destinations. Would definitely stay at this property again, when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, I would rate this an A-. Great Location, but rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: OilTechie
Reviews.Content: The GOOD.... Great Location. This Hotel is in a great location. It is off the main path, yet close to shopping, movie theaters, miniature golf, and generally any attraction in town is within a 10-15 min. drive (Following the Colored Routes. You can download a map of Branson showing these from the Silver Dollar City Website). The breakfest is good, pretty much covering any appetite. The Gift Shop attende will provide great time saving tips to get into your favorite show, along with helpful tips to great viewing areas for pre-shows like The Dixie Stampede - which was GREAT! This is a 100% Non-Smoking Hotel, and is kept up well. Very easy access into and out of the Hotel with plenty of parking. This Hotel is high up on a hill, with a great view. I believe they have around 320 rooms(Four Floors, One elevator). The BAD..... Check-in time was 3:00. When we arrived around 3:45, our room wasn't ready. They couldn't place us in another because the Hotel was sold-out for the night. It wasn't until 4:25 that our room was ready, and when we got to it, the maid was still just outside the room finishing up. The rooms are small with the double Queen Beds. There is very little space to place your luggage. The bathroom is of normal size - the length of a Bath Tug, but the second vanity area outside the bathroom is very small. The Suite only offer an additional 8' in room length for the couch. A couple of tips.... Unless you're a BIG old car fanatic, stay away when this event comes to town. Traffic is very very heavy all over town. Avoid 76 (main strip) when ever possible. Stay on the colored routes as much as possible, and try to get to know the side streets. Tne one colored route I foung most heavily traveled is the Yellow. Also 165 gets busy. And one last reccomendation......bring LOTS of loot. This is one expensive town!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean but extremely slow internet”
Reviews.Author: momyto2
Reviews.Content: this was our first vacation with a toddler and an infant also this is the first time we stayed at some place other than Hilton and i was sure impressed for the lower price a great vacation. The crowd was mostly family and elderly couples. Good things- The hotel is clean and nice. Pool starts at 3 ft so kids can be trained, sauna is good but gets crowded at some times and then there is no place to get in. But it is very clean with very good daily maintenance and open till midnight. i had read reviews on tripadvisor so has already asked the front desk to shut the motion sensor off for a/c also we didnt need the cooling so much as it was really cool. breakfast was good and for a vegetarian I could have the fresh fruits and yogurt. there are a number of different types of donuts which i had never seen before for breakfast so if you love coffee and donuts you are hooked :). The lady at the breakfast counter is very efficient for her age and does a great job The location is great, not noisy but accsesibl eto other areas of attractions also Kmart is close as i had forgotten to pack a number of things. cleaning staff is very well trained. room had a fridge micro and a coffee machine. The room has two sinks one outside and inside a must for people with kids. they do book show tickets for you but we dinnt need it. Shopping is so close by we did a lot at tangers outlet do make a trip. could work on- We checked in around 3:30 pm and had an infant in my arm. we entered the lobby and had to wait at the front desk for a couple of minutes, i waited to see if any of the person asks us to check in so was not impressed with that. Also front desk lady could have been more friendly. However the next day there was a man and another younger girl who were very friendly and nice so i guess it depended on whom you met at your first day. they also asked us how our stay was etc when we checked out. Coffee !! i have never had such diluted coffee before i dont know if it is my taste but really i brewed myself a cup at the room and again a dilute taste i really didnt like that only the breakfast coffee was OK. The internet was really very very slow so dont expect to work from here. There is that musty smell in the room which can be fixed with a dehumidifier but we didnt ask for one just turned the fan on high. Also there are annoying signs all over the place about towel counts, ac use, reusing towels, etc etc very weird for a hotel. Towels are very thin so you may want to carry your own to the pool. overall we enjoyed the hot tub and pool and may will visit again if we can.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place But One Serious Goofup!”
Reviews.Author: ExArmyRN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location, away from the busy areas of the city, but with quick access to all the main attractions on the strip (Highway 76). Rooms were quiet and clean. The dining area was adequate for the size of the hotel--it was nice to have a full hot complimentary breakfast. The only computer available for public use is in the lobby in front of and off to the side of the checkin/checkout area. Having the computer in a room dedicated for business use would be an improvement. The service actually wasn't bad overall but there was one serious mistake--the housekeeper did not properly close the door to our room after cleaning it. I found it closed but unlatched when I returned to the room. Nothing was missing but that is the first time I have ever had a housekeeper fail to close the room door properly. Hopefully, that is the last time I will experience that. I would still use this hotel again if I returned to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: dctc11
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute decision to go to Branson to watch my nephew play in an all-star basketball game but the staff at this hotel was very accomidating in all aspects of our visit with getting us a room to actually giving us an earlier check in time. The rooms were very clean and up to date. The decor was very beautiful and welcoming. The staff was very friendly and eager to please. My family had a great time and made this great time of honor to my nephew just that much more GREAT!!!! Will most definately stay here again in the future this is a great place. Also very accesible to almost every attraction in Branson without getting stuck in the traffic on the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cottorw
Reviews.Content: This is off the main road yet close enough to get to everything easily. Very clean, great staff and grounds. I have a 9year old and she enjoyed the clean pool. I would highly recommend Comfort Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: brdyldy
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money. Clean surroundings, excellent staff. Removed from the traffic, but easy to find and get to your other destinations in Branson. Certainly deserves your attention.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in every way”
Reviews.Author: lsroad
Reviews.Content: We took our grandchildren and had a wonderful stay. The pool, hot tub and sauna were great. The breakfast each day was hot and delicious. Location was great in getting to different shows and activities. Spotless and great hospitality...Will stay there again when we go back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: sunrise07
Reviews.Content: I'm standing here at the hotel's computer kiosk, writing this review before I forget the specifics. This is our last day of three at Branson, and we feel very fortunate that we chose Comfort Inn and Suites on Gretna Rd. for our hotel. It is further away from Silver Dollar City (a beautiful park with pristine grounds and the friendliest workers) than a few others; but, all roads are easily traveled in Branson, as we never got lost once, and were never stuck in a traffic jam. We could breeze right to Branson's Landing (highly recommended) and travel swifly to the main drag (although quite an eye-sore in our opinion). I would be remiss if I forgot to thank "Miss Pat" in the hotel's gift shop, as she color coded all trip routes for us on the Branson map...this was a definite Godsend. We purchased our tickets to SDC from her as well (buy one day get the 2nd free) and also our tickets to Ripley's (one of the better Ripley's around...although quite pricey!). The hotel itself sits on top of a hill, and has quite a grand appearance as you pull into the parking lot. It certainly has the feeling of a western lodge, both inside and out. During our entire stay, all workers have been genuinely kind, considerate, industrious and helpful. This is so hard to find...but we found it here! I'm a "clean-freak", always wiping down the walls, the handles, the floors, the everything...and not a single bit of dirt or debris was to be found in our room. That's simply astounding! Even more amazing is that we paid only $98.00/night for our room (we found a coupon in one of the Branson attraction magazines for a minimal discount). This just added to our delight with the hotel and our overall experience. The breakfast room has plenty of space; although, we almost had to eat out in the lobby at one point and time, but that would have been fine (it's gorgeous and accommodating). There are many food choices, such as scrambled eggs, biscuits and sausage gravy, oatmeal (with brown sugar added if you wish), an assortment of donuts, bagels, cereals, etc. There's also coffee (decaf and regular), juices, skim milk and 2%. I can't imagine a person wanting (or expecting) anything more than this. The lady who runs the breakfast room is quite exemplary...like a little hummingbird busily keeping all items stocked, trash emptied, and counters wiped. On our final night, we ordered pizza from Luigi's (there are 3 in Branson) at the recommendation of the hotel receptionist. The pizza arrived at our room in less than 35 minutes! Impressive! We ordered garlic cheese bread (soft and gooey...yet a light crisp crusp...mmmm!), a small special and a medium canadian bacon and mushroom, for a grand total of $26.75. The pizza was among the best we have ever eaten. The size of the pizza was more than generous for the 3 of us, and we had plenty left over. Tremendous! We are headed down to table rock lake now for 5 days...a perfect continuation of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to next time!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 26-May 30. Great place, hotel (cottage) was very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool and breakfast was great. You could not ask for better. A great vacation starts with a great place to stay and this place was surely it. Thanks for a great vacation. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: caist
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many places in Branson -- but this is definitely the best. This was our first stay and everything was great. Very big and clean room, delicious breakfast, great pool and hot tub - we couldn't have asked for anything more convenient. We are already planning our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeyJude55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay in Branson. This was a girls' getaway trip, and we could not have found a better place to stay. The hotel was very clean, both in the common areas and the rooms. We arrived a couple of hours early, but were able to check in early with no problem. The lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, pointing out the different areas of the hotel. The location is on the North side of Branson, which is quiet but very convenient to everything in Branson. It is especially close to all of the outlet malls. The breakfast was very good, and the area was kept clean and all food replenished as needed. We were able to find a table both mornings, so crowding wasn't a problem on this visit. There were lots of seats out by the pool and also in the lobby if needed. The lady working the breakfast room was so nice and pleasant. We visited with her, and she mentioned what a great place this was to work. It was obvious by the way we were treated that people who work at this hotel like their jobs and are proud of the hotel. Everyone was very friendly, from the people planting flowers outside, to the housekeeping lady we met in the hallway. This is not a fancy hotel, but the beds were very comfortable with lots of pillows. The little gift shop was a nice little extra, and ice and vending machines were easily available. I have been to Branson many times, but I have now found the hotel I will return to each time I visit Branson. You will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Nice Pool.”
Reviews.Author: lmceachen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway with our 2 1/2 year old son and 2 month old daughter. We liked that the location was not too far from the Landing, the main strip, and the outlet malls. We requested a king bed and a crib on the ground floor, but were told that we had to go up to the 3rd floor for a king. There is only one small elevator so there was often a wait. One employee told us there would be a $10 per night charge for the crib, another said it was free. It ended up that we were not charged extra for it. IThe crib was of the pack n'play variety with mesh sides and was waiting in our room for us upon arrival made up with a clean crib sheet. It was nice to have a mini fridge and microwave in the room. The wireless internet was easy to access. I agree with a previous post that mentioned that there are too many signs in the room, and I also don't like to be told which towels to use! The free breakfast offering was good. It consisted of three types of cereal (raisin bran, corn flakes and froot loops), milk, yogurt, fruit (bananas and apples), mini bagels, a variety of doughnuts, biscuits and gravy and scrambled eggs. There was also bread you could toast and assorted condiments. The juices offered were orange, cranberry and apple. There was plenty of quantity and selection and the dining and food service areas were kept clean and restocked although it was quite busy. The dining area overlooks the indoor pool. The heated indoor pool was quite nice and was clean. The hot tub was nice also. There are towels provided in the pool area. There were signs saying that children shouldn't be in the pool area unsupervised, but many seemed to be on their own with no parents around. All in all, this hotel provided a convenient location for a winter getaway and was a good value when you consider the included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: naper1
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay. This Comfort Inn was clean and well built. I couldn't here anyone above, next to our room, or in the hall for that matter. The beds were not too soft. There was a seperate sink outside of the bathroom. The bathroom wasn't the largest but was clean and well appointed (granite countertops). The breakfast room was also clean and had a good variety (cerieal, make your own waffles, hot eggs, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee, etc.). Watch out for the tour busses though. They will fill the breakfast room quickly as soon as it opens. Try to get there when it opens. There is a small gift shop on site if you need to book tickets. The best thing about this place was that it was off the main drag but not too far off (which I thought was unsightly.. another topic though). For a Comfor Inn, this one was nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassnkait
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 5 and had a suite with 2 queen beds and a fold out sofa bed. We had plenty of room and the person at the desk was so nice. She made sure we had plenty of everything we needed. The pool was really nice as well. The breakfast was ok, not really enough room in the dining area for us to eat though, a bit crowded.

Reviews.Title: “This is a worry free stay.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Coach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our son and his wife and their two daughters stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I can tell you without worry that you can reserve accomodations at the the Comfort Inn and Suites in Branson, Mo and know that you are going to the highest quality stay. The rooms are large, the beds are great for a good night's sleep and the pillows are the best we've ever found. The free continental breakfast has something for everyone and the food is fresh and very tasty. The staff is very freindly no matter where you meet them. If you are planning a trip to Branson, Mo, stay at this Copmfort Inn and you will see there is no worry about what kind of stay you will have.

Reviews.Title: “TOP OF THE HILL”
Reviews.Author: SGW83
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. Very, very clean, excellent breakfast, friendly staff and nice view. They can book your shows for you. Pool and hot tub were great.......open til midnight. A very nice treat after a night on the town. The lobby feels like you are in a lodge. Overall an excellent place to stay. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “As best as they come!”
Reviews.Author: FredVirginiaBeach_VA
Reviews.Content: We spent three days and two nights at Branson Meadows Comfort Inn & Suites. I can not say enough about the staff, cleanliness and decor. This is by fair the best Comfort Inn we have ever stayed. I express doubt that any other Comfort Inn is as good. They have set a bench mark that will be very challenging to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: smkon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our weekend trip to Branson and we know for sure we made an excellent decision to stay at this hotel. The location of the hotel is pretty nice. We drove from hotel right into the downtown in just 5-7 mins. travel time. No traffic whatsoever to encounter and yet we were still in Branson! The hotel staff was downright plesant and helpful. Our room was 2 Queens and was spacious enough to easily accomodate 4 adults and 1 child. There were lots of children on our floor still we didnot hear any noise once we were in our room. The free breakfast was really "deluxe" although the breakfast room was always crowded. We had to take our plates and sit in the lobby area both the days. It was bit uncomfortable and messy to feed our 13 months old daughter sitting on couch. But it's not a complaint - just a minor discomfort. The hotel also has an indoor pool. Although we didnot use it, we clearly saw that it was a big hit with other children. All in all, we would stay ONLY in this hotel for our future trips to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaUSA
Reviews.Content: The last three trips my family and I have taken to Branson, we have stayed at this hotel. I know for certain we will continue to stay here everytime we come back to Branson. The lady that works the gift shop does an outstanding job of ordering your tickets for you and she is as friendly as she can be. Those of you with kids know how picky they can be sometimes at breakfast, but they always enjoy making the waffles and the rest of the breakfast they have at the hotel. I really enjoy the lobby area, and as an early riser, I enjoy going down there in the mornings and having a cup of coffee while reading the paper. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We enjoy the Dixie Stampede and have found a neat, easy route from the hotel to the show. It includes a few residental streets, but you are in and out of there with no wait in traffic. There is a really neat craft mall just right down the street from the hotel that my wife really enjoys. I further enjoy the military discount that the hotel provides everytime we come up there. Having traveled quite a bit, I can say that it has to be one of the best military discounts out there. I am currantly getting ready to come home from Iraq, and my family and I are planning a trip back to Branson this fall to spend time together. We are bringing my 70 year old Mom and Step-Dad. We will definately be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stculey
Reviews.Content: My husband and two kids just returned from a two night stay. We have been to Branson many times and have stayed at many Hotels. This one by far is our favorite. We will never have to stay anywhere else. The grounds of the Hotel are beautiful and well kept, the lobby is nice(hot, fresh coffee and hot chocolate at your disposal) the employees were friendly and very knowledgeable about attractions and good places to eat. Our room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was very good and well stocked. We will have to look no farther for a place to stay in Branson the next time we return.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable, clean, and nice location”
Reviews.Author: PoliticoJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just far enough from the action that traffic is no problem, with grocery and gas nearby. The strip is five minutes drive. Perfect location. Housekeeping great. Slight musty smell can be totally attributed to local humidity. Goes away when the air is on. And I'm picky about smell. Not a problem. Bedding clean and comfortable, with pillow options. Breakfast okay, but eggs prefab. But more than normal "continental" fare. Coffee weak, but that's normal for a Comfort Inn. If we ever return to Branson, we'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jlb3456
Reviews.Content: Our family has not had a vacation for three years and I really was looking forward to a nice week. Staying at this hotel helped us have a great vacation. The rooms were very clean and came with a microwave and refrigerator which were so handy. The staff always checked to make sure your needs were met and questions were answered with patience. I can't say enough about the hot breakfast! Thank you again for a wonderful vacation. Will stay here everytime we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPhD
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Comfort Inn with a few Branson touches. The room was clean, but smelled a little moldy (it is Missouri, after all). I agree with the person who said that all of the signs in the room could get annoying. I don't really need to know that they want me to feel like Jesus, what towels I should use for what, or that I shouldn't steal anything. I guess you could argue, though, that it's better than them not caring at all. I was just passing through and liked the relatively quiet location (of course there were kids running loose), but if you are into the shows and Branson "entertainment," this place isn't in the heart of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price and Service!”
Reviews.Author: sjdaid
Reviews.Content: We chose Comfort Inn & Suites Branson because of price, but didn't realize the value we would get! The rooms were quiet and very clean. The hotel staff (especially the gift shop attendant) was extremely helpful. The "continental" breakfast was not "continental" at all, MUCH more, including hot waffles, selection of donuts, oatmeal, cereals, bagels, etc! We couldn't believe the value. The location is perfect for avoiding the congestion of 76 Hwy. We could slip in and out of the strip using the alternate routes without issue. About 10 mins. to Silver Dollar City, or to the other end of the city (Landing). Indoor pool and hot tub were great and heated. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LSJAAA
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with kids Staff wonderful Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in Branson Missouri”
Reviews.Author: EBRNielsen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet was very good and included make your own waffles. We stayed in the cottage and LOVED it - no noise from other hotel guests, our own deck with patio furniture, and plenty of room for our family of four. This hotel is located just a few miles from the very busy Highway 76 strip in Branson. It was wonderful to be able to come back to a hotel that was located on a quiet street, away from all of the noise and traffic of the main road in Branson. And, the hotel sits atop a hill and has a great scenic view of part of the city. We were very impressed with this property and will return again!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its name!”
Reviews.Author: zahmuffinmom
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn and Suites - Branson Meadows in Branson, MO. We had a wonderful time! The hotel is very well maintained and seems to be relatively new. We had a suite on the fourth floor which gave our family of four ample space to spread out. Every employee we encountered was friendly, helpful, and professional. The amenities include a breakfast with waffles, oatmeal, doughnuts, bagels, cereal, biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, fruit, etc. The hotel has a very nice indoor pool and hot tub, and a fitness center. It is situated off the beaten path in an area that is not highly developed, and has a nice walking/running trail on the grounds. There is also a gift shop and ticketing/reservation service available. We were able to reserve tickets for the Dixie Stampede and Yakov Smirnoff through this office at discounted rates. We didn't experience any difficulties or problems during our stay and recommend this hotel to anyone - there were young families, older couples, and multigenerational families as well as tour groups and family reunions there while we were - looking for a reasonably priced high quality place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: lizTexas
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at this hotel!! It's off the beaten path but the excellent service is worth the extra drive to attractions and shows. We've been coming to Branson for the past 10 years. We usually stay at another hotel property but their service and cleanliness has gone downhill. I looked on TripAdvisor and saw the reviews and kept calling the hotel until they had a cancellation for us to book our tip with them. The reviews are true!! We were very pleasantly surprised at the friendliness! ALL the staff is friendly and the best thing we loved is that the breakfast room is only supposed to be open until 9:30am. We didn't make it down until 10:00am and everything was still open!! They didn't push anybody to rush down as do some hotels with their breakfasts. You either get there on time or you're out of luck. Not so with this hotel. We will definately come back again!! One suggestion, how about a frequent visitor card so free stays can be accumulated. Great Job--Keep it Up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice, Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sworks
Reviews.Content: I selected this particular Comfort Inn based on Trip Advisor ratings and the fact that the management responded to negative comments online (saw no other Branson properties doing this!). Great price of $71.00 per night, very clean throughout! Rooms were very well insulated, ours was next to elevator and never heard it operating (despite being used often). Indoor pool was immaculate! Free breakfast was excellent with make your own waffles and good variety of pastry items to please the family (why spend $6-8 per person for warmed over buffet food and have to drive somewhere else?). Great gift shop with genuinely discounted merchandise, not the phoney "80% off" you see at the area outlet shops. Only hiccup of the whole stay was missed linen service one day (we were napping with "Do Not Disturb" sign on door) It should have been rescheduled by the attendant. Location is a plus as well, easy acess to 65 and 76 Hwys. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: arkham
Reviews.Content: PROS: Low prices, nice amenities for families, the breakfast is better than the average "continental" fare. CONS: Smallish rooms, too many little cardboard signs throughout the guestroom with everything from biblical verse to infoming guests that they count towels. Kinda weird.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Love2ShopMissouri
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night at the Best Western Branson Towers which was terrible. The smoking rooms made it unbearable so we went to the Comfort Inn & Suites which is all no smoking. It was so nice. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We had a nice clean room with safe, refridgerator, iron, ironing board, and blow dryer. There was a bath and shower with an additional sink area outside the bathroom which is always a plus. My husband loved the high speed internet within the rooms. The pillows are nice and soft and plentiful. The indoor pool area is nice with a jaccuzi and sauna. There is also a very nice exercise room as well as an arcade/activity room. The complimentary breakfast has more than some offer. They have biscuits and gravy, waffles, oatmeal, cereal, doughnuts, etc. The seating is limited which was our only complaint. This is a new hotel and very clean. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: pompon15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn and Suites Branson on April 2-6, 2007. Upon arriving we booked our reservation on the hotel website for $76.49 per night. It was a good deal and after reading positive reviews we decided to book. When we arrived we were very surprised to see out name on the marque. It was a nice extra touch. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were willing to go out of their way to help us. Everytime you would walk through the lobby area they would always speak to us. The hotel is very, very, very clean. I am extremly picking and it was up to my standards. Everything appeared spotless and tidy. The pool area was large for an indoor area. Maintance crew members were always around in case something needed fixed or cleaned up. THe breakfast was very simple. but adequete. It served the purpose. There was always plenty of foof to go around. As far as the location, it was hidden away from the road a bit so it was less noisy than the stuff on the strip. It was only a short drive to attractions. There is nothing really in walking distance because of busy roads. This hotel is extremly well maintained and they have a wonderful management staff. I would recomend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to Branson. It was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: ArTravelguru2
Reviews.Content: Not as pleasant as their description says. Uncomfortable beds, noisy pool area and priced to high. Would recommend staying at the Hilton for a few $$ more.

Reviews.Title: “Above average and above the crowds”
Reviews.Author: freetoroam
Reviews.Content: As a child my first vacation trip was to Branson. That was over 50years ago. I'm sorry to say that the excessive commercial development of the area has ruined some fond memories of a lovely and peaceful village in the Ozarks. It's interesting that the locals have chosen to call the main entertainment road "the strip." Indeed, the hills look like casualties to strip mining. We feared the Comfort Inn and Suites in Branson Meadows would be another disappointment. We read a recent review in TripAdvisor from a contributor from WI. The review was quite negative. Well, the writer must have been staying somewhere else, because we found this Inn to be outstanding and none of their complaints were obvious during our stay. The whole property was "clean as a pin" and had the feel of a high quality Country Lodge. The indoor pool was very nice, the breakfast area was spacious and well supplied. But the big plus was the staff. These people from the front desk to housekeeping all went above and beyond the norm to make us feel at home and meet all of our requests. Having been an investor in the hospitality industry before my retirement 2 years ago, I can spot enlightened ownership that puts an emphasis on staff training. This is a well trained group. The location which is away from the crowds and overlooking the town from a choice vantage place was the right formula to turn our visit into a pleasant time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Karen008
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - everything was very new and clean. The pictures from Expedia are very accurate. The pool was great - the water was a comfortable temperature and there were plenty of towels. I liked the waffle makers. Sometimes it got crowded in the breakfast room and people needed to wait for seats. It would have been nice if there was a ping pong table added so there could be more things to do in the hotel. Our room was clean and the staff were friendly. I also liked that they had a computer in the lobby that we could use to check our email and look up directions and other things on the web. While we were there the printer did not work though. All in all a wonderful experience. I would definitely stay here next time I come to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 4 days and loved it- clean and convenient to drive to attractions”
Reviews.Author: dwightnc6
Reviews.Content: Great newer facitlity convenient to drive to attractions without being on the hectic main drag. Continental breakfast was very good. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great Branson hotel”
Reviews.Author: IPJSIllinois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Branson for a last minute getaway on March 25-28. I had done some research on places to stay since we have never been to Branson before. And because this is the start of their "season" we went with no reservations. We decided to stay at this hotel based on previous reviews on this site and also information provided on their website. We ended up getting a room with a king bed and hot tub for 2. Check in was fast and efficient. The gal behind the counter was very friendly and she was some sort of manager also. The room was a good size with plenty of room to move around. The hot tub is in the room and not the bathroom. We were very pleased with the room. Everything was seemed new and clean. No worn bedding, no marks on the walls, no worn down furniture. Also the hallways and exterior of the building was well maintained. We were totally comfortable in our room. The hotel also offers a deluxe continental breakfast but I cannot comment on that as we never went down to eat in the mornings. The hotel is away from the main drag but still close enough to all the theaters and shops. The pool water was at a good temperature. The only thing is pool towels were a little ragged and thin. But overall I would recommend this hotel to all travelers. I don't think you will be disappointed. Also this hotel recently became an all non smoking hotel. We had a great stay there.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites Branson Meadows
HotelInfo.Address: 5150 Gretna Road, Branson, MO 65616
